phase: Phase 7: Third-Party and Contracted Service Provider Monitoring Discovery

task_results.task: Web search discovery for contracted service providers
key_findings: GOV.UK Notify SMS providers: Firetext and MMG (£98.2M each, 2-year contracts)
GOV.UK Pay payment service provider tender (£49.2M)
UKSBS and SSCL as major shared service providers
Technology Services 4 Framework (£16B)
Project Gigabit broadband infrastructure (£2B+)
Oracle Cloud Infrastructure migration (260K users via SSCL)

task_results.task: Web search discovery for GDS-hosted services
key_findings: 5 major digital platforms: Notify, Pay, One Login, Forms, Digital Marketplace
7 GDS APIs: Bank Holidays, Data.gov.uk, Content, Notify, Organisations, Pay, Search
GOV.UK Design System framework
UK Emergency Alerts system
GDS organizational merger in January 2025

task_results.task: Manual review of Government Digital Service directory
key_findings: Official directory at /government/digital-services does not exist (404)
X-GOVUK community list maintains 400+ government services
Community list hosted at govuk-digital-services.herokuapp.com
GitHub repo: x-govuk/govuk-services-list
No official registry since registers service retired in 2021

task_results.task: Web search discovery for shared services
key_findings: SSCL: £300M contract extension, 29 departments, 260K cloud users
UKSBS: Government-owned shared services provider
NHS SBS: NHS-specific shared services
5 cloud-based shared service centres target by 2028 (delayed from 2025)
Expected savings of 10-15% in operating costs
Digital platforms (Notify, Pay, Forms) function as shared services

task_results.task: Manual review of UK Public Accounts Committee reports
key_findings: Government spends £14B+ annually on digital technology suppliers
No central record of digital procurement spending
15 full-time staff manage all technology supplier relationships
Digital Commercial Centre of Excellence: 24 experts (vs 6,000 commercial staff)
28% of central government systems are legacy IT
Market dominated by small number of large suppliers
Electronic tagging programme cited as transformation failure example
pac_recommendations: Create central record of digital spending by autumn 2025
Scale up Digital Commercial Centre of Excellence

gaps_identified: No official government service directory (retired in 2021)
No central procurement spending database (£14B untracked)
Insufficient digital commercial expertise (24 vs needed)

organizational_changes.merger: GDS, CDDO, AI Incubator, Geospatial Commission, Responsible Tech Adoption Unit
organizational_changes.parent: Department for Science, Innovation and Technology (DSIT)

data_quality_notes: PAC report URLs returned 403 errors (restricted parliamentary content)
No single authoritative source for government service list
Community-maintained X-GOVUK list most comprehensive (400+ services)
Contract values based on public announcements and tender notices
Third-party SMS provider endpoints not publicly documented
Government lacks central spending database per PAC reports

tier_1_critical.name: GOV.UK One Login
tier_1_critical.justification: Beta service, future authentication standard for government

tier_2_important.name: GOV.UK Forms
tier_2_important.justification: Beta platform for government form creation

next_steps: Review X-GOVUK services list for additional monitorable services
Cross-reference discovered services with existing config.yaml
Prioritize services by criticality and user base
Validate API endpoints for automated monitoring
Track organizational changes from January 2025 GDS merger
